decks.notes: The deck is focused on quickly deploying a board of aggressive Merfolk creatures, buffed by lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Merfolk Trickster and Harbinger of the Seas, providing control and tempo advantage. The use of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Sink into Stupor and Force of Negation provide protection and disruption against opposing strategies. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of Merfolk creatures while disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent through various counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to control the board with cards like Wrath of the Skies and Flame of Anor while also having access to the powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to outvalue the opponent. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to slowly grind out the opponent while maintaining control of the game. It also includes some land destruction spells like Invert Polarity and Galvanic Discharge to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with different abilities to create a toolbox of options for various situations. Combining creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Springheart Nantuko with cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact allows for flexibility and versatility in finding specific creatures needed to win the game. Cards like Thassa's Oracle and Delighted Halfling provide alternative win conditions, while support cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Urza's Saga help control the game and set up the combo. Overall, the deck aims to assemble the right combination of creatures and cards to outmaneuver and defeat the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game using a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive enchantments while building up resources and card advantage. The deck aims to stall the game with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and The One Ring, controlling the board with cards like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies, and disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Dress Down and Leyline Binding. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to close out the game once control has been established.

This deck focuses on utilizing a wide variety of creatures and spells to put pressure on the opponent quickly and aggressively. With a mix of powerful creatures like Nishoba Brawler and Scion of Draco, along with efficient removal and protection spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of Leyline cards and Tribal Flames adds versatility and flexibility to the deck's strategy, making it a strong contender in 1 vs 1 Modern matches.

This deck focuses on filling the graveyard with creatures and then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once, overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence. Cards like Grief, Subtlety, and Generous Ent help disrupt the opponent's strategy while also filling your graveyard. Shardless Agent and Curator of Mysteries help cycle through the deck to find key combo pieces. With the right setup, this deck can quickly turn the game in your favor and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. It aims to protect its key card, The One Ring, which provides powerful effects and can help close out the game. The deck also includes cards that disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide utility lands. Overall, the deck looks to grind out advantages and eventually overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and control elements.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo utilizing creatures as toolbox pieces. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact to search for key creatures, players aim to quickly assemble The One Ring combo for a game-winning finish. Cards like Shuko and Arboreal Grazer aid in quickly assembling the combo pieces, while cards like Delighted Halfling and Nadu, Winged Wisdom provide additional value and utility. The deck also includes lands like Urza's Saga and Khalni Garden to further support the combo strategy.

The deck focuses on tutoring and utilizing a variety of creatures with unique abilities to create a powerful combo strategy. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact, the player can search for specific creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom or Endurance to control the board or win the game. The deck also includes utility cards like Shuko and Springheart Nantuko to further support the combo strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of lands like Otawara, Soaring City and Undercity Sewers provide additional versatility and options for the player.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with unique abilities to create powerful combo plays and toolbox options. It includes a mix of creatures with abilities like sacrificing for value, tutoring other creatures, and providing protection or evasion. The deck also includes cards to rapidly search for specific creatures, enabling the player to adapt to different situations and combos. Additionally, the mana base includes a variety of lands to support the creature toolbox strategy and ensure consistent mana production.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with various abilities to quickly assemble a powerful combo, supported by cards like Summoner's Pact and Chord of Calling. The key strategy involves tutoring for the necessary pieces, such as The One Ring and Nadu, Winged Wisdom, while using tools like Shuko and Delighted Halfling to enhance the combo's effectiveness. The land base includes utility lands like Cavern of Souls and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect key creatures and ensure success. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently search for and assemble its combo pieces to achieve victory.

The main focus of this Modern Merfolk deck is to quickly build a board presence with aggressive Merfolk creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and tap-down effects. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and having a mix of disruptive and lord effects, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful tempo strategy. It also leverages tribal synergies with lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the power of the Merfolk creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and utilizing artifact synergy to overwhelm the opponent with a high-powered aggro strategy. By utilizing cards like Springleaf Drum and Thoughtcast to quickly ramp, along with efficient creatures like Memnite and Frogmite, the deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence. The inclusion of cards like Ornithopter and Cranial Plating help to boost the aggression even further, while cards like Urza's Saga provide additional value and resources. The goal is to swarm the opponent with a fast and efficient army of artifacts.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana through cards like Ruby Medallion, Desperate Ritual, and Manamorphose to cast powerful spells such as Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible. With cards like Wish and Past in Flames, the deck focuses on recurring key spells and setting up explosive turns to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Valakut Awakening and Arid Mesa allows for card selection and fetching specific lands to further support the combo strategy. This deck aims to create a fast and efficient win condition through a flurry of spells and mana generation.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board and manipulate the game with the powerful card, The One Ring. By using a combination of control spells, counterspells, and removal, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up for a win condition with The One Ring. The deck also includes various utility lands and versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Time Raveler to further control the game and maintain an advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on outsmarting the opponent and ultimately winning through clever plays and strategic decisions.

The main concept of this deck is to use UrzaTron lands to quickly generate a large amount of mana in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells. By assembling Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower, the deck can easily produce enough mana to play threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Karn, the Great Creator. In addition, cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while All Is Dust can clear the board of opposing threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and control effects.
